pattern: "Sorry, honey. Let's see. we're meeting the Sombergs for lunch and four of

examples.en: 'The Phantom of the Opera'. Then we'll come home."
Here is the Lotte amusement park
상대방에게 뭔가를 물어볼 때는 Do you
examples.ko: Do you know where my house is? 우리집이 어디 있는지 알아요?

examples.en: Do you know how airplane fly
When Beethoven gives birth go her children I'll give you one of them.

pattern: Later would you like to invite me

examples.en: I want to go your house. I want to be there
examples.ko: 너네 집에 가고 싶어. 거기서 지내고
You'll be there. 우리집에서 지내게 할께요.

pattern: "Philip, why don't you spend the night here?," suggested Mom

examples.en: "Oh, thanks, Mrs Lee. I'll call my parents."
무엇하는게 낫겠어요라고 할때는 might(may) as well
examples.ko: "I might as well spend the night here." 여기서 자고 가는게 낫겠어요.
난 여기 앉아 있는 데 지쳤어요.

pattern_ko: 라는 말이지? Are you saying that

examples.en: Are you saying that all they do is watching TV?
examples.ko: 그 애들이 하는 거라곤 TV만 본다는 말이지요?

examples.en: You can give it to them over the weekend before you see the doctor.
examples.ko: 네가 그걸 일주일 안에 부모님에게 가져다 드려 의사에게 가기 전에 말이지요.
